variants.Description in input context: The variant Q65X results in a premature stop codon, leading to a truncated protein.

Material used.Material Source: HEK293T cells transfected with plasmids encoding the wild-type and mutant alpha-synuclein proteins

Readout description.Result Description: The mutant alpha-synuclein protein was undetectable compared to the wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein protein was used as a positive control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by a post-hoc test for multiple comparisons was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: The intensity of the alpha-synuclein band should be comparable to that of the loading control (e.g., Actin) and similar across all samples.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: The intensity of the alpha-synuclein band should be significantly reduced or absent compared to the wild-type and loading control.
